Description: Fragment of an East Greek pottery closed vessel, oenochoe or amphora; slipped very thinly on the exterior. Rear legs of a hoofed animal walking to right; an outline rosette between its legs, and a dot rosette at the left break; red on its haunch.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 6, no. 10 pl. 3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.925)
